heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 26 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (182°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (230.0°) by approximately 48.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the inside temperature (down 1.9°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 5%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 388 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 292 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 388.3m lower than yesterday, 177.0m lower than the past week, 292.5m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 845m and a peak of 2560m, averaging 1016.0m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; relatively cool weather. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and winds will be practically absent. Showers, occasional overcast conditions, and it’s dark. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
